metadata.titleCn: 小蛋白数据库SmProt的更新升级
metadata.description: Small protein is the floorboard of the length is less than 100 amino acid protein.SmProt contains the gene encoding protein records, especially from small protein UTR and non-coding RNA.Selected small protein is data through the analysis of the ribosome, literature, and mass spectrometry (MS) identified in humans, mice and other species.SmProt also contains the collected small protein sequence characteristics, genome location, tissue/cell lines, which can reflect the coding potential evaluation, function, mutation, and has been verified or predict related diseases, etc.Pay special attention to reliability, the relationship between variation, small proteins and diseases, tissue/cell/large increase in data set, translation initiation, PhyloCSF scores, translation and other detailed information.Data processing and quality control from the GEO database downloaded 547 Ribo ENA - seq fastq file data sets.Manual check each data set to confirm sequencing joint.A use cutadapt 1.18 delete joint, only keep the length of 25 to 35 bp readings.Then use the STAR 2.5.2 a, use EndToEnd mode will sequence is mapped to the latest genome, allow at most two mismatches.Ribo - seq quality and P locus deviation by Ribo - TISH quality assessment module.For TI - seq data, pay more attention to the quality of TIS (-t).Then manually check to verify that the offset value and eliminate no obvious triplet periodic data set.After quality control, retained the 419 Ribo - seq data set.Translation of ORF by Ribo TISH forecast module.Incorporate a data set is the same duplicate data processing of biology and technology.Candidate ORF the minimum length is set to five amino acids.Considering the ATG and nearly cognate initiation codon (unlike ATG has a base), rRibo - use only CHX seq dataset and there is no matching TI - seq data analysis by twice.One is predicted with standard start codon ATG ORF, another is the forecast has nearly cognate initiation codon (Alt) ORF.Prefer the data in our database evidence rather than previous assumptions, only report the same ORF multiple candidate start codon (-- framebest) the best framework of test result.For data set containing TI - seq data, including alternative initiation codon (Alt), and based on the LTM TI - seq and based on the TI - HARR seq (- HARR) set up different parameters.
metadata.descriptionCn: 小蛋白是长度小于100个氨基酸的蛋白质的总称。 SmProt 包含由基因编码的小蛋白的记录，尤其是来自 UTR 和非编码 RNA 的小蛋白。 选定的小蛋白是通过核糖体分析数据、文献、质谱 (MS) 等在人、小鼠等物种中进行鉴定。 此外，SmProt 还包含所收集的小蛋白质的序列特征、基因组位置、组织/细胞系、反映编码潜力的评估、功能、变异以及已被验证或预测的相关疾病等。特别关注可靠性、变异、小蛋白与疾病之间的关系、组织/细胞系/数据集的大量增加、翻译起始、PhyloCSF 分数、翻译水平和其他详细信息。数据处理及质控上，从 GEO 和 ENA 数据库下载了 547 个 Ribo-seq 数据集的 fastq 文件。手动检查每个数据集以确认测序接头。a使用 cutadapt 1.18 删除接头，只保留了长度为 25-35 bp 的读数。 然后使用 STAR 2.5.2a，使用 EndToEnd 模式将序列映射到最新的基因组，允许最多 2 个错配。Ribo-seq 质量和 P 位点偏移由 Ribo-TISH 质量模块评估。对于 TI-seq 数据，更多关注 TIS 质量 (-t)。然后进行手动检查以验证偏移值并消除没有明显三重态周期性的数据集。质量控制后，保留了 419 个 Ribo-seq 数据集。翻译的 ORF 由 Ribo-TISH 预测模块预测。 合并一个数据集中相同处理的生物学和技术重复数据。候选 ORF 的最小氨基酸长度设置为 5。考虑到 ATG 和近同源起始密码子（与 ATG 有一个碱基不同），rRibo-seq 数据集仅使用 CHX 而没有匹配的 TI-seq 数据被分析两次。 一种是预测具有规范 ATG 起始密码子的 ORF，另一种是预测具有近同源起始密码子 (--alt) 的 ORF。在我们的数据库中更喜欢数据证据而不是先前的假设，只报告了同一 ORF 中多个候选起始密码子的最佳框架测试结果（--framebest）。对于包含 TI-seq 数据的数据集，包括替代起始密码子 (--alt)，并为基于 LTM 的 TI-seq 和基于 HARR 的 TI-seq (--harr) 设置了不同的参数。

background: Small proteins specifically refer to proteins consisting of less than 100 amino acids translated from small open reading frames (sORFs), which were usually missed in previous genome annotation. The significance of small proteins has been revealed in current years, along with the discovery of their diverse functions. Genome annotation is fundamental to life science. In recent years, it has been found that small open reading frames (sORFs) widely exist in genomes of many organisms including humans and human microbiomes, and some are able to be translated into small proteins. Small proteins are proteins with less than 100 amino acids, which may be derived from untranslated regions (UTRs) of mRNAs or non-coding RNAs (ncRNAs) including primary microRNAs (pri-miRNAs), long ncRNAs (lncRNAs), and circular RNAs (circRNAs). Small proteins were usually missed in previous coding sequence annotation, while their significance has been revealed in current years for diverse functions, such as embryonic development, cell apoptosis, muscle contraction, and antimicrobial activity. Despite the abundance of sORFs in genome, the number of well-studied small proteins is very limited. Annotation of numerous small proteins will contribute to studies on various physiological and pathological processes. Identification of small proteins at proteomic level is challenging. Mass spectrometry (MS) can provide direct evidence of small proteins, but it relies much on the coverage of existing libraries, which mainly focus on large proteins rather than small proteins. Ribosome profiling (also named as ribosomal footprinting or Ribo-seq) provides a more sensitive way for global detection of translation events based on the deep sequencing of ribosome-protected mRNA fragments (RPFs), which allows for identifying the location of translated ORFs and translation initiation sites (TISs), the distribution of ribosomes on mRNA, and the speed of translating ribosomes. Emerging evidence shows that many upstream ORFs (uORFs) act in cis to regulate the translation of downstream ORFs by leaky scanning, reinitiation, and ribosome stalling. Given the great importance of small proteins, in-depth investigations of small proteins across various species are in need.
research objective: SmProt was specially developed to provide valuable information on small proteins for scientific community. Here we present the update of SmProt, which emphasizes reliability of translated sORFs, genetic variants in translated sORFs, disease-specific sORF translation events or sequences, and remarkably increased data volume. SmProt is dedicated to integrating knowledge of small proteins translated from various sources, especially for those from UTRs and ncRNAs.
challenges: Identification of small proteins at proteomic level is challenging. Mass spectrometry (MS) can provide direct evidence of small proteins, but it relies much on the coverage of existing libraries, which mainly focus on large proteins rather than small proteins. Protease cleavage sites are lacking in small proteins due to the limited length. Besides, small proteins are usually of low abundance, and tend to be filtered out during enrichment process.
methods: The fastq files of 547 Ribo-seq datasets were downloaded from GEO and ENA databases. Each dataset was checked manually to confirm the sequencing adapters. The adapters were removed using cutadapt 1.18 and only reads with 25–35 bp in length were retained. Then the sequences were mapped to the latest genome using STAR 2.5.2a using EndToEnd mode with allowance of up to 2 mismatches. Ribo-seq quality and P-site offsets were assessed by Ribo-TISH quality module. Manual checks were then carried out to verify offset values and eliminate datasets without obvious triplet periodicity. After the quality control, 419 Ribo-seq datasets were retained. Translated ORFs were predicted by Ribo-TISH predict module. Minimum amino acid length of candidate ORFs was set to 5. For datasets containing TI-seq data, alternative start codons were included (--alt), and different parameters were set for LTM-based TI-seq and HARR-based TI-seq (--harr). sORFs with less than 100 amino acids were filtered from the prediction results above. In-frame reads of sORFs were counted and normalized by library sequencing depth (in-frame total reads count) and sORF length. Variants were called individually in each sample using the HaplotypeCaller tool. Variants with QualByDepth (QD) < 2 were removed using VariantFiltration tool. Disease-specific translation events as well as disease-specific SNVs of small proteins in 16 types of diseases were identified.
dataset: SmProt incorporated 638,958 unique small proteins curated from 3,165,229 primary records, which were computationally predicted from 419 ribosome profiling (Ribo-seq) datasets or collected from literature and other sources from 370 cell lines or tissues in 8 species (Homo sapiens, Mus musculus, Rattus norvegicus, Drosophila melanogaster, Danio rerio, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, Caenorhabditis elegans, and Escherichia coli). In total, 25,475 variants located on translated sORFs were provided.
findings: In brief, SmProt integrates small proteins from large amount of ribosome profiling data, and provides more abundant details. We strongly believe that SmProt will provide valuable and accurate information on small proteins for scientific community. Moreover, SmProt provides a new resource for users interested in functional and mechanistic studies, and a reference for construction of MS libraries of small proteins.
backgroundCn: 小蛋白质特指由少于100个氨基酸组成的蛋白质，这些蛋白质是由小开放阅读框（sORFs）翻译而来的，通常在之前的基因组注释中被忽视。近年来，小蛋白质的重要性得到了揭示，并且发现它们具有多样的功能。基因组注释是生命科学的基础。近年来，发现小开放阅读框（sORFs）广泛存在于包括人类及其微生物组在内的许多生物的基因组中，其中一些能够被翻译成小蛋白质。小蛋白质是指少于100个氨基酸的蛋白质，这些蛋白质可能源自mRNA的非翻译区（UTRs）或非编码RNA（ncRNAs），包括初级微RNA（pri-miRNAs）、长非编码RNA（lncRNAs）和环状RNA（circRNAs）。小蛋白质通常在之前的编码序列注释中被忽视，但近年来它们在胚胎发育、细胞凋亡、肌肉收缩和抗菌活性等多种功能中的重要性得到了揭示。尽管基因组中存在大量的sORFs，但经过充分研究的小蛋白质数量仍然非常有限。对众多小蛋白质的注释将有助于对各种生理和病理过程的研究。在蛋白质组学层面上识别小蛋白质具有挑战性。质谱（MS）可以提供小蛋白质的直接证据，但它在很大程度上依赖于现有文库的覆盖范围，而这些文库主要集中在大蛋白质上，而非小蛋白质。核糖体谱分析（也称为核糖体足迹法或Ribo-seq）提供了一种更灵敏的方式，通过深度测序核糖体保护的mRNA片段（RPFs）来全球检测翻译事件，这使得能够识别翻译开放阅读框的位置和翻译起始位点（TISs）、核糖体在mRNA上的分布以及翻译核糖体的速度。新兴证据表明，许多上游开放阅读框（uORFs）通过漏扫、再启动和核糖体停滞等机制在顺式调节下游开放阅读框的翻译。鉴于小蛋白质的重要性，亟需对不同物种的小蛋白质进行深入研究。
research objectiveCn: SmProt专门开发用于为科学界提供小蛋白质的有价值信息。我们在此呈现SmProt的更新，强调翻译的小开放阅读框（sORFs）的可靠性、翻译sORFs中的遗传变异、特定疾病相关的sORF翻译事件或序列，以及显著增加的数据量。SmProt致力于整合来自各种来源的小蛋白质知识，特别是来自非编码RNA和非翻译区（UTRs）的蛋白质。
challengesCn: 在蛋白质组学层面上，小蛋白的鉴定具有挑战性。质谱（MS）可以提供小蛋白的直接证据，但它在很大程度上依赖于现有文库的覆盖范围，而这些文库主要集中于大蛋白而非小蛋白。由于小蛋白的长度有限，酶切位点的缺乏。此外，小蛋白通常丰度较低，往往在富集过程中被过滤掉。
methodsCn: 从GEO和ENA数据库下载了547个Ribo-seq数据集的fastq文件。每个数据集都进行了手动检查以确认测序接头。使用cutadapt 1.18去除接头，并仅保留长度在25–35 bp之间的读取。然后，使用STAR 2.5.2a将序列映射到最新的基因组，采用EndToEnd模式，允许最多2个错配。通过Ribo-TISH质量模块评估Ribo-seq的质量和P位点偏移。随后进行了手动检查以验证偏移值，并剔除没有明显三联体周期性的数据显示集。经过质量控制后，保留了419个Ribo-seq数据集。通过Ribo-TISH预测模块预测翻译的ORF。候选ORF的最小氨基酸长度设置为5。对于包含TI-seq数据的数据集，包含了替代起始密码子（--alt），并为基于LTM的TI-seq和基于HARR的TI-seq设置了不同的参数（--harr）。从上述预测结果中过滤掉氨基酸少于100的sORF。对sORF的框内读取进行计数，并根据文库测序深度（框内总读取计数）和sORF长度进行标准化。使用HaplotypeCaller工具在每个样本中单独调用变异。使用VariantFiltration工具去除QualByDepth（QD）< 2的变异。识别出16种疾病中特异的翻译事件以及小蛋白质的疾病特异性SNV。
datasetCn: SmProt 收录了 638,958 个独特的小蛋白，这些蛋白是从 3,165,229 条原始记录中整理而来的，经过计算预测，数据来源于 419 个核糖体测序（Ribo-seq）数据集，或从文献及其他来源收集，涉及 370 种细胞系或组织，涵盖 8 种生物（人类、鼠类、大鼠、果蝇、斑马鱼、酿酒酵母、线虫和大肠杆菌）。总共有 25,475 个位于翻译的小开放阅读框（sORFs）上的变异被提供。
findingsCn: SmProt整合了大量核糖体剖析数据中的小蛋白，并提供了更丰富的细节。我们坚信，SmProt将为科学界提供有价值和准确的小蛋白信息。此外，SmProt为对功能和机制研究感兴趣的用户提供了一个新资源，并为小蛋白质质谱库的构建提供了参考。

Verification.QuestionEn: Do data collection methods in this domain involve manual checks to confirm sequencing adapters in Ribo-seq datasets?
Verification.QuestionCn: 在这个领域的数据收集方法中，是否涉及手动检查以确认Ribo-seq数据集中的测序接头？

Verification.QuestionEn: Is mass spectrometry considered a challenging method for identifying small proteins due to the coverage of existing libraries?
Verification.QuestionCn: 质谱法由于现有数据库的覆盖范围，被认为是识别小蛋白质的一种具有挑战性的方法吗？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Is the identification of small proteins more effectively done through mass spectrometry, ribosome profiling, or another method?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 小蛋白质的鉴定是通过质谱、核糖体谱或其他方法更有效？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: For ensuring data quality in small protein datasets, is manual inspection of sequencing adapters, automated tools, or a combination of both more effective?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 为了确保小型蛋白质数据集的数据质量，手动检查测序接头、自动化工具，还是两者结合使用更有效？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: In the collection of small protein data, are ribosome profiling datasets, literature sources, or other methods more commonly used?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 在小蛋白质数据的收集中，核糖体剖析数据集、文献来源或其他方法更常用吗？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What methods are used to confirm sequencing adapters in data collection for small protein research?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在小蛋白质研究的数据收集过程中，用于确认测序接头的方法有哪些？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Where are the ribosome profiling datasets, used for predicting small proteins, typically sourced from?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 用于预测小蛋白质的核糖体剖析数据集通常来源于哪里？
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: GEO 和 ENA 数据库

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What challenges exist in using mass spectrometry for small protein identification?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在使用质谱法进行小蛋白质鉴定时存在哪些挑战？

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used for identifying small proteins across different species?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一种用于识别不同物种中小蛋白质的数据收集方法的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: One example of a data collection method used for identifying small proteins across different species is ribosome profiling (Ribo-seq), which allows for the detection of translation events by sequencing ribosome-protected mRNA fragments. In the SmProt database, 547 Ribo-seq datasets were downloaded from GEO and ENA databases, manually checked for sequencing adapters, and processed to retain reads of 25-35 bp in length to map sequences to the latest genome.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种用于识别不同物种小蛋白的数据收集方法是核糖体剖析（Ribo-seq），它通过测序被核糖体保护的mRNA片段来检测翻译事件。在SmProt数据库中，从GEO和ENA数据库下载了547个Ribo-seq数据集，手动检查了测序接头，并处理以保留长度为25-35 bp的读取，以便将序列映射到最新的基因组。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in identifying small proteins at the proteomic level?
Example.QuestionCn: 在蛋白质组水平上识别小蛋白质时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a challenge faced in identifying small proteins at the proteomic level is the reliance on mass spectrometry (MS) for direct evidence, which is often limited by existing libraries predominantly focused on large proteins. This challenge is compounded by the lack of protease cleavage sites due to the small size of these proteins and their low abundance, making them prone to being filtered out during enrichment processes.
Example.AnswerCn: 在蛋白质组学层面识别小蛋白时面临的一个挑战是对质谱（MS）直接证据的依赖，这通常受到现有文献库主要集中于大蛋白的限制。由于这些蛋白质的体积小且丰度低，缺乏蛋白酶切割位点，这一挑战更加复杂，使得它们在富集过程中容易被过滤掉。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a dataset that integrates knowledge of small proteins from diverse sources?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个整合来自不同来源的小蛋白质知识的数据集示例？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a dataset that integrates knowledge of small proteins from diverse sources is the SmProt database, which incorporates 638,958 unique small proteins from 3,165,229 primary records. These records are computationally predicted from 419 ribosome profiling datasets and are collected from literature and other sources, covering 370 cell lines or tissues across 8 species, including Homo sapiens and Mus musculus.
Example.AnswerCn: SmProt数据库是一个整合了来自多种来源的小蛋白知识的数据集，包含638,958个独特的小蛋白，来自3,165,229个原始记录。这些记录是从419个核糖体剖析数据集中计算预测得出的，并且收集自文献和其他来源，涵盖了370个细胞系或组织，涉及8个物种，包括人类（Homo sapiens）和小鼠（Mus musculus）。

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many Ribo-seq datasets were retained after quality control in the data collection method?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在数据收集方法中，经过质量控制后保留了多少个Ribo-seq数据集？

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the total number of unique small proteins incorporated into a dataset?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 数据集中包含的独特小蛋白质的总数是多少？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many species are covered by the small proteins dataset?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 小蛋白质数据集中涵盖了多少种类？

Definition.QuestionEn: How is ribosome profiling (Ribo-seq) used in the data collection process for small proteins?
Definition.QuestionCn: 核糖体剖析（Ribo-seq）在小蛋白的数据收集过程中是如何使用的？
Definition.AnswerEn: Ribosome profiling, or Ribo-seq, is used for the global detection of translation events by deep sequencing ribosome-protected mRNA fragments. This method allows researchers to identify the location of translated open reading frames (ORFs), translation initiation sites, distribution of ribosomes on mRNA, and the speed of translating ribosomes. It provides a sensitive approach to detect small proteins that may be missed in other proteomic analyses.
Definition.AnswerCn: 核糖体剖析（Ribo-seq）是一种通过深度测序核糖体保护的mRNA片段来全球检测翻译事件的方法。该方法使研究人员能够识别翻译开放阅读框（ORF）的位点、翻译起始位点、核糖体在mRNA上的分布以及翻译核糖体的速度。它提供了一种灵敏的方法来检测在其他蛋白质组分析中可能被遗漏的小蛋白。

Definition.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with the identification of small proteins at the proteomic level, and how are these addressed in data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在蛋白质组学层面上，识别小蛋白质面临哪些挑战，以及在数据收集中如何解决这些问题？
Definition.AnswerEn: The identification of small proteins at the proteomic level is challenging due to their low abundance, the lack of protease cleavage sites, and the tendency to be filtered out during the enrichment process. These challenges are addressed by leveraging ribosome profiling (Ribo-seq) for a more sensitive detection method and by incorporating data from mass spectrometry, literature, and other sources to enrich the dataset with small proteins that might otherwise be missed.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在蛋白质组学层面上，小蛋白的识别具有挑战性，原因包括其低丰度、缺乏蛋白酶切割位点以及在富集过程中容易被过滤掉。这些挑战通过利用核糖体谱序列分析（Ribo-seq）作为一种更灵敏的检测方法来解决，并通过结合质谱、文献和其他来源的数据，丰富小蛋白的数据集，以便捕捉到那些可能被遗漏的小蛋白。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How does the data collection method using Ribo-seq compare to mass spectrometry (MS) in terms of identifying small proteins?
Comparison.QuestionCn: Ribo-seq 数据收集方法与质谱（MS）在识别小蛋白质方面的比较如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Ribo-seq provides a more sensitive way for global detection of translation events, allowing the identification of translated ORFs and translation initiation sites, whereas mass spectrometry (MS) provides direct evidence of small proteins but relies heavily on the coverage of existing libraries which focus more on large proteins.
Comparison.AnswerCn: Ribo-seq 提供了一种更灵敏的全球翻译事件检测方法，能够识别翻译的开放阅读框（ORF）和翻译起始位点，而质谱（MS）则提供小蛋白的直接证据，但在很大程度上依赖于现有文库的覆盖，这些文库更侧重于大蛋白。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in handling and processing datasets from GEO and ENA databases versus those from literature and other sources in terms of small protein identification?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在小蛋白质鉴定方面，处理和处理来自GEO和ENA数据库的数据集与来自文献和其他来源的数据集之间的差异是什么？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Datasets from GEO and ENA undergo a detailed processing pipeline involving adapter removal, genome mapping, and quality assessment before contributing to small protein identification, whereas those from literature and other sources might not follow such a standardized processing protocol.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 来自GEO和ENA的数据集经过详细的处理流程，包括接头去除、基因组比对和质量评估，然后才用于小蛋白的鉴定，而来自文献和其他来源的数据集可能没有遵循这样的标准化处理协议。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do alternative start codons in datasets containing TI-seq data compare to canonical start codons in terms of predicting translated ORFs?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在包含TI-seq数据的数据集中，替代起始密码子与经典起始密码子在预测翻译的开放阅读框（ORFs）方面的比较如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: For datasets containing TI-seq data, alternative start codons are included with different parameters set for LTM-based and HARR-based TI-seq, whereas datasets without TI-seq data predict translated ORFs primarily based on canonical start codons, highlighting a difference in approach towards start codon recognition.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 对于包含TI-seq数据的数据集，使用不同的参数设置LTM-based和HARR-based TI-seq时会包含替代起始密码子，而没有TI-seq数据的数据集主要基于经典起始密码子预测翻译的开放阅读框，突显了在起始密码子识别方面的方法差异。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the lack of protease cleavage sites affect the identification of small proteins at the proteomic level, and what data collection methods could mitigate this challenge?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 缺乏蛋白酶切割位点可能会影响小蛋白在蛋白质组学水平上的识别，而哪些数据收集方法可以缓解这一挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The lack of protease cleavage sites can make it challenging to identify small proteins because these sites are necessary for standard proteomic analysis using mass spectrometry. Alternative data collection methods such as ribosome profiling, which does not rely on protease cleavage, can provide a more sensitive approach to detecting translation events and identifying small proteins.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 缺乏蛋白酶切割位点可能使得识别小蛋白质变得具有挑战性，因为这些位点对于使用质谱进行标准蛋白质组分析是必要的。替代的数据收集方法，如核糖体剖析，不依赖于蛋白酶切割，可以提供更灵敏的检测翻译事件和识别小蛋白质的方法。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What does the integration of ribosome profiling data from multiple species reveal about the cross-species conservation of small proteins, and how might this influence future data collection strategies?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 整合来自多个物种的核糖体分析数据揭示了小蛋白在跨物种间的保守性，这可能会如何影响未来的数据收集策略？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The integration of ribosome profiling data across multiple species reveals the potential for cross-species conservation of small proteins, suggesting that certain small proteins may play fundamental biological roles. This insight could influence future data collection strategies by prioritizing the identification and validation of conserved small proteins across diverse species, thus enhancing our understanding of their evolutionary significance and functional roles.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 跨物种的核糖体剖析数据整合揭示了小蛋白的跨物种保守性潜力，表明某些小蛋白可能在生物学中发挥基本作用。这一见解可能会影响未来的数据收集策略，优先考虑在不同物种中识别和验证保守的小蛋白，从而增强我们对它们的进化意义和功能角色的理解。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the difficulty of identifying small proteins at the proteomic level?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在蛋白质组学水平上识别小蛋白质的困难因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The identification of small proteins at the proteomic level is challenging due to the reliance on existing mass spectrometry libraries that primarily focus on larger proteins. Additionally, small proteins often lack protease cleavage sites because of their limited length, are usually of low abundance, and tend to be filtered out during the enrichment process.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在蛋白质组学层面上，小蛋白的识别具有挑战性，因为现有的质谱库主要集中于较大蛋白。此外，小蛋白通常由于其有限的长度而缺乏蛋白酶切割位点，通常丰度较低，并且在富集过程中往往被过滤掉。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why do genome annotation processes often overlook small proteins?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 基因组注释过程常常忽视小蛋白质的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Small proteins are often missed in genome annotation because they are translated from small open reading frames (sORFs) that were not traditionally included in previous genome annotations. These sORFs can be located in untranslated regions (UTRs) or non-coding RNAs, such as primary microRNAs, long ncRNAs, and circular RNAs, which were not the focus of earlier annotations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 小蛋白质常常在基因组注释中被遗漏，因为它们是从小开放阅读框（sORFs）翻译而来的，这些sORFs在以前的基因组注释中通常未被纳入。这些sORFs可以位于非翻译区（UTRs）或非编码RNA中，例如初级微RNA、长非编码RNA和环状RNA，而这些在早期的注释中并不是重点。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes variability in the quality and reliability of ribosome profiling data for small proteins?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致小蛋白质的核糖体剖析数据质量和可靠性变异的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Variability in ribosome profiling data quality and reliability can arise from the manual checking process to confirm sequencing adapters, the removal of adapters using specific software, and the mapping of sequences to the latest genome which allows for mismatches. Additionally, quality control measures, such as evaluating Ribo-seq quality and P-site offsets, as well as manual verification of triplet periodicity, contribute to variability. The retention of only high-quality datasets after these checks further impacts the reliability of data used for predicting translated ORFs.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 核糖体剖析数据质量和可靠性的变异可能源于手动检查过程以确认测序接头、使用特定软件去除接头以及将序列映射到最新基因组时允许错配。此外，质量控制措施，如评估Ribo-seq质量和P位点偏移，以及手动验证三联体周期性，也会导致变异。在这些检查后仅保留高质量数据集进一步影响了用于预测翻译开放阅读框（ORF）的数据可靠性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential impacts on the reliability of small protein identification when employing ribosome profiling with a focus on translated sORFs?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在关注翻译的小开放阅读框架（sORFs）时，使用核糖体谱分析对小蛋白质鉴定的可靠性可能产生的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The use of ribosome profiling allows for a more sensitive detection of translation events, which enhances the reliability of identifying translated sORFs. This method helps in pinpointing the location of translated ORFs and translation initiation sites, thus increasing the accuracy and reliability of small protein identification.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 核糖体剖析的使用可以更敏感地检测翻译事件，从而增强识别翻译的小开放阅读框（sORFs）的可靠性。这种方法有助于确定翻译开放阅读框的位置和翻译起始位点，从而提高小蛋白质识别的准确性和可靠性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of using mass spectrometry with existing protein libraries primarily focused on large proteins for the identification of small proteins?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用主要针对大蛋白质的现有蛋白质库进行质谱分析以识别小蛋白质的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The reliance on existing protein libraries that focus on large proteins can limit the identification of small proteins due to insufficient coverage. This often results in the exclusion of small proteins during the detection process, making mass spectrometry less effective for identifying low-abundance small proteins without tailored libraries.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 对现有蛋白质库的依赖，尤其是那些专注于大蛋白质的库，可能会限制小蛋白质的识别，因为覆盖范围不足。这通常导致在检测过程中排除小蛋白质，使得质谱在识别低丰度小蛋白质时效果不佳，而没有定制的蛋白质库。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to develop a comprehensive database of small proteins derived from untranslated regions and non-coding RNAs?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 开发一个全面的小蛋白质数据库，这些蛋白质来源于非翻译区和非编码RNA，为什么重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is important to develop a comprehensive database of small proteins derived from untranslated regions and non-coding RNAs to integrate knowledge of small proteins from various sources, which were often missed in prior genome annotations, and to facilitate studies on their diverse functions in physiological and pathological processes.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 开发一个全面的数据库，收录来自非翻译区和非编码RNA的小蛋白质是重要的，这样可以整合来自不同来源的小蛋白质知识，这些小蛋白质在之前的基因组注释中常常被遗漏，并且有助于研究它们在生理和病理过程中的多样功能。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can ribosome profiling data be preprocessed to ensure accurate identification of small open reading frames in various species?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何对核糖体剖析数据进行预处理，以确保在各种物种中准确识别小开放阅读框？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The preprocessing of ribosome profiling data involves downloading fastq files from GEO and ENA databases, manually checking sequencing adapters, and using cutadapt 1.18 to remove adapters while retaining reads of 25-35 bp in length. The sequences are then mapped to the latest genome using STAR 2.5.2a in EndToEnd mode, allowing for up to 2 mismatches. Ribo-seq quality and P-site offsets are assessed using the Ribo-TISH quality module, followed by manual checks to verify offset values and eliminate datasets without clear triplet periodicity.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: ribosome profiling 数据的预处理包括从 GEO 和 ENA 数据库下载 fastq 文件，手动检查测序接头，并使用 cutadapt 1.18 去除接头，同时保留长度在 25-35 bp 的读段。然后，使用 STAR 2.5.2a 在 EndToEnd 模式下将序列比对到最新的基因组，允许最多 2 个错配。使用 Ribo-TISH 质量模块评估 Ribo-seq 的质量和 P 位点偏移，随后进行手动检查以验证偏移值，并剔除没有明显三联体周期性的 数据集。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodological steps are essential in identifying disease-specific translation events and genetic variants in translated small open reading frames?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 识别特定疾病的翻译事件和翻译小开放阅读框中的遗传变异的关键方法步骤有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The identification of disease-specific translation events and genetic variants involves using the HaplotypeCaller tool to call variants individually in each sample, removing variants with QualByDepth (QD) < 2 using the VariantFiltration tool, and integrating results to identify disease-specific translation events and SNVs of small proteins in 16 types of diseases.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 识别特定疾病的翻译事件和遗传变异涉及使用HaplotypeCaller工具在每个样本中单独调用变异，使用VariantFiltration工具去除QualByDepth (QD) < 2的变异，并整合结果以识别16种疾病中的特定疾病翻译事件和小蛋白的单核苷酸变异（SNVs）。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data processing techniques enable the integration and quality control of ribosome profiling datasets for small protein identification?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据处理技术能够实现核糖体剖析数据集的整合和质量控制，以便识别小蛋白？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration and quality control of ribosome profiling datasets for small protein identification are enabled by techniques such as manual checking for sequencing adapters, using cutadapt to remove adapters, mapping sequences to the latest genome version using STAR with specific settings, and assessing Ribo-seq quality and P-site offsets with Ribo-TISH quality module. Manual checks are also conducted to verify offset values and eliminate datasets without obvious triplet periodicity.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 小蛋白质鉴定的核糖体剖析数据集的整合和质量控制通过以下技术实现：手动检查测序接头，使用cutadapt去除接头，将序列映射到最新的基因组版本，使用STAR并设置特定参数，评估Ribo-seq质量和P位点偏移，使用Ribo-TISH质量模块。还进行手动检查以验证偏移值，并排除没有明显三联体周期性的数据显示集。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the identification of small proteins at the proteomic level be challenging, and what data collection methods are used to address these challenges?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在蛋白质组学水平上识别小蛋白可能具有挑战性，以及使用哪些数据收集方法来应对这些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The identification of small proteins at the proteomic level is challenging due to the limited length of small proteins, which results in a lack of protease cleavage sites, their low abundance, and their tendency to be filtered out during the enrichment process. Mass spectrometry (MS) can provide direct evidence but relies heavily on existing libraries that focus on large proteins. Ribosome profiling (Ribo-seq) offers a more sensitive method for detecting translation events by sequencing ribosome-protected mRNA fragments, helping to identify translated ORFs and translation initiation sites.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在蛋白质组学层面上，小蛋白的鉴定具有挑战性，因为小蛋白的长度有限，导致缺乏蛋白酶切割位点、丰度低以及在富集过程中容易被过滤掉。质谱（MS）可以提供直接证据，但在很大程度上依赖于专注于大蛋白的现有数据库。核糖体测序（Ribo-seq）通过测序被核糖体保护的mRNA片段，提供了一种更灵敏的检测翻译事件的方法，帮助识别翻译的开放阅读框（ORF）和翻译起始位点。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What might be the reasons for the high volume of data collected from ribosome profiling datasets, and how does this impact the expectation of dataset refinement in this field?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 从核糖体分析数据集中收集大量数据的原因可能是什么，这如何影响该领域数据集精炼的预期？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The high volume of data collected from ribosome profiling datasets is likely due to the need for detailed analysis of translation events, including identifying translated ORFs, translation initiation sites, and ribosome distribution on mRNA. This comprehensive data collection is expected to enhance dataset refinement by providing abundant details and ensuring high-quality data through rigorous quality control processes. The large data volume helps in creating a more accurate and reliable resource for small protein research.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 从核糖体剖析数据集中收集的大量数据，可能是由于需要对翻译事件进行详细分析，包括识别翻译的开放阅读框（ORF）、翻译起始位点以及核糖体在mRNA上的分布。这种全面的数据收集预计将通过提供丰富的细节和确保通过严格的质量控制过程来增强数据集的精炼。大量的数据有助于为小蛋白质研究创建一个更准确和可靠的资源。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you perceive the challenges faced in identifying small proteins at the proteomic level, and what techniques could enhance reliability?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您如何看待在蛋白质组水平上识别小蛋白所面临的挑战，以及哪些技术可以提高可靠性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Identifying small proteins at the proteomic level is challenging due to the lack of protease cleavage sites and low abundance of small proteins, which often leads to their exclusion during enrichment processes. Enhancing reliability might involve improving mass spectrometry library coverage to include small proteins or using ribosome profiling to provide sensitive detection of translation events, identifying translated ORFs, and mapping translation initiation sites.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在蛋白质组水平上识别小蛋白质具有挑战性，因为小蛋白质缺乏蛋白酶切割位点且丰度低，这通常导致它们在富集过程中被排除。提高可靠性的方法可能包括改善质谱文库的覆盖范围，以包括小蛋白质，或使用核糖体剖析提供对翻译事件的敏感检测，识别翻译的开放阅读框（ORF）并绘制翻译起始位点。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your view, how could the integration of genetic variants and disease-specific translation events enhance the utility of a dataset in small protein research?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在您看来，整合遗传变异和疾病特异性翻译事件如何能增强小蛋白研究中数据集的效用？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Integrating genetic variants and disease-specific translation events could significantly enhance the utility of a dataset in small protein research by providing insights into the functional and pathological roles of small proteins. This approach allows for the identification of disease-specific SNVs and translation events, facilitating targeted studies on physiological and pathological processes, and thereby potentially contributing to the development of disease-specific therapies.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 整合遗传变异和疾病特异性翻译事件可以显著增强小蛋白研究数据集的实用性，通过提供小蛋白的功能和病理角色的见解。这种方法允许识别疾病特异性的单核苷酸变异（SNV）和翻译事件，促进对生理和病理过程的针对性研究，从而可能有助于开发疾病特异性疗法。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection methods ensure the reliability and accuracy of small protein identification in this domain.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集方法如何确保在该领域小蛋白质鉴定的可靠性和准确性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data collection methods include downloading fastq files from GEO and ENA databases, manual verification of sequencing adapters, and using specific software such as cutadapt to remove adapters and STAR for mapping sequences to genomes. Quality control is assured by assessing Ribo-seq quality and P-site offsets through the Ribo-TISH quality module and manual verification of triplet periodicity.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法包括从GEO和ENA数据库下载fastq文件，手动验证测序接头，并使用特定软件如cutadapt去除接头，使用STAR将序列映射到基因组。通过评估Ribo-seq质量和P位点偏移，使用Ribo-TISH质量模块进行质量控制，并手动验证三联体周期性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges faced when identifying small proteins at the proteomic level.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定在蛋白质组学层面识别小蛋白时面临的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Identifying small proteins at the proteomic level is challenging due to the lack of protease cleavage sites because of their limited length, low abundance which causes them to be filtered out during enrichment processes, and dependence on coverage of existing libraries that focus on large proteins rather than small proteins.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在蛋白质组学层面识别小蛋白质具有挑战性，因为它们的长度有限，缺乏蛋白酶切割位点，低丰度导致它们在富集过程中被过滤掉，并且现有的库主要集中于大蛋白质，而不是小蛋白质。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges associated with identifying small proteins at the proteomic level and discuss potential methodologies to address these challenges.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析在蛋白质组水平上识别小蛋白所面临的挑战，并讨论解决这些挑战的潜在方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Identifying small proteins at the proteomic level presents challenges due to issues like the limited coverage of existing mass spectrometry libraries, which focus on larger proteins, and the lack of protease cleavage sites in small proteins because of their limited length. Small proteins are also usually of low abundance and may be filtered out during the enrichment process. To address these challenges, methodologies that involve enhancing the sensitivity of detection tools such as mass spectrometry and ribosome profiling (Ribo-seq) can be employed. Ribosome profiling, in particular, allows for a more sensitive global detection of translation events, providing insights into the location of translated ORFs and translation initiation sites, which can aid in identifying small proteins that are otherwise missed.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在蛋白质组学层面识别小蛋白质面临挑战，原因包括现有质谱库的覆盖范围有限，主要集中于较大蛋白质，以及小蛋白质由于长度有限而缺乏酶切位点。小蛋白质通常丰度较低，可能在富集过程中被过滤掉。为了解决这些挑战，可以采用增强检测工具（如质谱和核糖体测序（Ribo-seq））灵敏度的方法。特别是核糖体测序，能够更敏感地全球检测翻译事件，提供翻译开放阅读框（ORF）和翻译起始位点的位置洞察，这有助于识别那些通常被遗漏的小蛋白质。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please propose a strategy for expanding the robustness and reliability of data collection methods used in compiling datasets of small proteins.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请提出一个策略，以增强用于编制小蛋白质数据集的数据收集方法的稳健性和可靠性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: To expand the robustness and reliability of data collection methods for small protein datasets, one could focus on integrating multiple data sources, such as ribosome profiling (Ribo-seq) datasets and literature-based evidence. Enhancing the quality control processes, such as manual verification of sequencing adapters and ensuring triplet periodicity in datasets, can improve data integrity. Additionally, incorporating advanced prediction modules like Ribo-TISH for translated ORFs and setting stringent parameters for inclusion criteria, such as minimum amino acid length and consideration of alternative start codons, can aid in creating a more comprehensive and reliable dataset.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 为了增强小蛋白质数据集的数据收集方法的稳健性和可靠性，可以重点整合多个数据源，例如核糖体测序（Ribo-seq）数据集和基于文献的证据。增强质量控制流程，例如手动验证测序接头和确保数据集中的三联体周期性，可以提高数据的完整性。此外，结合先进的预测模块，如Ribo-TISH用于翻译的开放阅读框（ORF），并设定严格的纳入标准，例如最小氨基酸长度和考虑替代起始密码子，可以帮助创建更全面和可靠的数据集。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential strategies for enhancing the comprehensiveness of datasets related to small proteins, considering both technological advancements and data integration approaches.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨增强与小蛋白质相关的数据集的全面性的潜在策略，考虑技术进步和数据集成方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Enhancing the comprehensiveness of small protein datasets could involve leveraging technological advancements in sequencing and data analysis tools, such as improved ribosome profiling techniques that offer higher resolution and accuracy. Integrating data from diverse sources, including different species, cell lines, and tissues, could provide a more holistic view. Additionally, employing computational predictions alongside experimental data, such as Ribo-TISH for ORF predictions and including variant analysis, can enrich the dataset. Ensuring the inclusion of disease-specific translation events and genetic variants from various diseases can also expand the dataset's applicability and relevance.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 增强小蛋白质数据集的全面性可以通过利用测序和数据分析工具的技术进步来实现，例如改进的核糖体剖析技术，提供更高的分辨率和准确性。整合来自不同来源的数据，包括不同物种、细胞系和组织，可以提供更全面的视角。此外，结合计算预测与实验数据，例如用于开放阅读框（ORF）预测的Ribo-TISH，并包括变异分析，可以丰富数据集。确保纳入特定疾病的翻译事件和来自各种疾病的遗传变异，也可以扩展数据集的适用性和相关性。
